rules.author: hackafterdark
rules.message: Database query uses string formatting (e.g., fmt.Sprintf), which is a SQL injection vulnerability. Use parameterized queries instead.
rules.description: Detects the use of string formatting functions like fmt.Sprintf inside database calls, which is a common SQL injection vector. Promotes the use of safe, parameterized queries.

rules.author: hackafterdark
rules.message: Avoid using net/http/cgi package due to vulnerability to httpoxy attacks (CVE-2015-5386)
rules.description: Detects usage of the vulnerable net/http/cgi package which is susceptible to httpoxy attacks

rules.author: hackafterdark
rules.message: Database query uses fmt.Sprintf, which is a SQL injection vulnerability. Use parameterized queries with placeholders ($1, $2, etc.) instead.
rules.description: Detects the use of fmt.Sprintf in database calls, which is a common SQL injection vulnerability.
